intro: Descurainia subscandens, commonly known as prairie hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils, and it produces bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and somewhat woody. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions, making it a common sight in arid and semi-arid regions.
